page.title: 03Poor's Piece
page.content: There's a piece of land at the corner of Tuttle Hill and Mancetter Road called{Poor's Piece,}so named because it was set aside for the poor in the early 19th century.Now it is part of a disused quarry surrounded by a fence. To get into this land you have to go through a car-park and down a steep slope. It is a very nice place with a lot of natural life around. There are bushes and grass everywhere and lots of{hawthorn}trees which provide places for a variety of birds to nest. By the side of a small pool there is a picnic table from where you can hear the birds singing and enjoy the scenery. Nearby on the{Coventry Canal}is {Boon's Wharf,}owned by{British {Waterways.}It was built so that stone from the local quarry could be loaded onto barges and sent all over the country. Today it is disused.
